content: hooded cowl designed for urth yarns by rosann fleischauer materials 2 skeins urth harvest worsted needles us size 8 20 circular us size 7 20 circular notions stitch markers tapestry needle gauge body of hood 18 sts x 24 row in stockinette stitch = 4 square ribbing 28 sts x 24 row in k1p1 = 4 square abbreviations bobble = bind off eor = end of round k = knit k2tog = knit 2 stitches together m1l = make 1 left m1r = make 1 right p = purl psso = pass slipped stitch over p2tog = purl 2 stitches together pm = place marker sm = slip marker ssk = slip slip knit sts = stitches pattern using smaller needle cast on 138 sts pm and join in the round being careful not to twist cowl and hood round 1 *k1 p1 repeat to end of round from * round 2-­ 56 repeat round 1 change to larger needle round 57 *k1 p1 k1 p1 k2tog repeat to end of round from * -­ 115 sts round 58-­ 60 knit round 61 m1 k to end of round m1 -­ 117 sts round 62-­ 64 knit from this point forward the hood is worked flat row 1 ssk knit to two stitches from end of row k2tog -­ 115 sts row 2 purl row 3-­ 4 repeat row 1-­ 2 -­ 113 sts row 5 knit row 6 p2tog purl to two stitches from end of row s1 psso -­ 111 sts row 7 knit row 8-­ 15 repeat row 6 -­ 7 four more times -­ 103 sts row 16 purl row 17 knit row 18 repeat row 6 -­ 101 sts continue in stockinette stitch until work measures 19 1/2 from cast on edge ending with a purl row crown to soften the line of the hood a small tab is added only to one side of the work this tab is incorporated into the kitchener seam to complete the crown row 1 k6 turn work row 2 p6 turn work row 3 k4 turn work row 4 p2tog p2 -­ 100 sts bind off using a kitchener stitch incorporating the four extra row at the front of the crown to form a slight increase at the top of the forehead at the end of the kitchener seam do not cut the yarn on the wrong side of the work weave the working yarn down five row sew a small seam from this point back to the kitchener seam five stitches in from the corner this will form a small triangle which will give the back of the hood at the crown a softer rounded look when the hood is turned to the right side ribbing on hood with the right side facing and using the smaller circular needle pick up starting from the bottom of the hood near the neck a total of 112 sts one stitch in from the selvage edge of the work picking
